actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title IV of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to prohibit federally ordered assignment of teachers or students on racial and other similar grounds.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Provides, under the Civil Rights Act, that no U.S. court or any Federal official shall be empowered to compel the assignment of teachers or students to schools, classes, or courses for reason of race, religion, sex, or national origin. States that Federal grants for education shall not be conditioned upon such assignment.

titles.title: A bill to amend title IV of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to prohibit federally ordered assignment of teachers or students on racial and other similar grounds.
